attributes.action: Introduce 'I voted' stickers at polling stations for all elections in the UK.
attributes.background: 'I Voted' stickers are commonly used in the US elections and a way to display pride in civic engagement and also used to encourage and to remind people to vote. It would be an inexpensive and popular way of increasing voter participation in British elections.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

The Electoral Commission is responsible for running public awareness campaigns around elections and referendums and is independent of the UK Government and Parliament. They also issue guidance to the returning officers who run elections.

You may wish to make the suggestion to them.
